main.model

Class CircularParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.model.CircularParser

  • public class CircularParser
extends java.lang.Object
    Note: This is the first version of the CircularParser. It does not yet account for sequencing errors (e.g. overlaps in the reference sequence or a read missing bases in homopolymers such as polyA regions).

    This is the core class of the model. Detects cross-border reads which are reads aligned at least two times to the reference sequence such that it overlaps both at the beginning and at the end of the reference sequences in a fitting manner such that these occurrences of the same read can be combined to one occurrence.

    Apart from that, offers many interfaces to be used by the view / control.

    • Method Detail

      • parse

        public static void parse(java.io.File referenceSequencesFASTAFile,
                         int referenceSequenceToSelect,
                         java.io.File readsBAMFile,
                         java.io.File readsBAIFile)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Iterates over all mapped reads in order to detect cross-border reads and save these into a convenient representation setting the attributes of the ReferenceSequences and Reads classes.

        The SamReader.query( ) method will be used if readsBAIFile is not null. Due to the fact that there have in fact been contradicting measurements on different hardware as to whether the SamReader.query( ) version is actually faster than the version with just looping over the entire BAM file once, both versions remain implemented.

        Parameters:
        referenceSequencesFASTAFile - a FASTA file containing the reference sequence(s)
        referenceSequenceToSelect - the index of the reference sequence to be used
        readsBAMFile - a BAM file containing the reads to be parsed
        readsBAIFile - the reads BAI file, may be null
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • constructCrossBorderRead

        private static Read constructCrossBorderRead(Read oldRead,
                                             htsjdk.samtools.SAMRecord newReadRecord,
                                             boolean oldReadIsLeft)
        Constructs a cross-border read given two presentations of the same read aligned fittingly such that one overlaps at the beginning and the other one at the end. Updates alignmentStart / getAlignmentEnd, builds a new fitting Cigar combing the two old ones and transfers the sequence from the newReadRecord if the oldRead is hard clipped. After applying the algorithm, 
         ( Read is combined <=> read.alignmentStart > read.alignmentEnd )
        holds.
        Parameters:
        oldRead - the read which was already seen by the CircularParser
        newReadRecord - the new read found in the BAM record
        oldReadIsLeft - whether the oldRead is left (that is to say, mapped to the beginning of the reference sequence)
        Returns:
        oldRead
